nl: Let $V$ be a vector space over an infinite field $F$. Show that $V$ cannot be the set-theoretic union of a finite number of proper subspaces of $V$.
lean:
∀ {F V ι: Type*} [Infinite F] [Field F]
  [AddCommGroup V] [Module F V] [Finite ι] {u : ι → Submodule F V}
  (hu : ∀ i : ι, u i ≠ ⊤) :
  (⋃ i : ι, (u i, Set V)) ≠ ⊤
candidate: ∀ {F : Type*} [Field F] [Infinite F] {V : Type*} [AddCommGroup V] [Module F V] (k : ℕ) (M : Fin k → Submodule F V) (hM : ∀ i, (M i).toAddSubgroup < ⊤), ¬ (⨆ i, M i).toAddSubgroup = ⊤
imports:
import Mathlib

open Fintype Set Real Ideal Polynomial
open scoped BigOperators
